body_html:
I just had the same problem on a completely different project and I could resolve it by defining the _DARWIN_C_SOURCE preprocessor macro. This can either be done by using a compiler flag or by including something like

#ifdef __APPLE__
#define _DARWIN_C_SOURCE
#endif

at the top of the affected source file.
body_text:
I just had the same problem on a completely different project and I could resolve it by defining the _DARWIN_C_SOURCE preprocessor macro. This can either be done by using a compiler flag or by including something like
#ifdef __APPLE__
#define _DARWIN_C_SOURCE
#endif

at the top of the affected source file.
body:
I just had the same problem on a completely different project and I could resolve it by defining the `_DARWIN_C_SOURCE` preprocessor macro. This can either be done by using a compiler flag or by including something like

```
#ifdef __APPLE__
#define _DARWIN_C_SOURCE
#endif
```

at the top of the affected source file.
